p: Human‐assisted evolution of coral reef organisms is another novel management tool, whereby genetically modified stress‐tolerant corals are transplanted onto reefs (Anthony, 2016; van Oppen et al., 2015). This could also increase organisms’ resilience to environmental change by increasing resistance to stressors such as warming and acidification, and recovery from disturbances (van Oppen et al., 2015), and could maintain important ecosystem services provided by corals (Anthony, 2016). However, it could lead to a monopoly of a few resistant species, reducing overall biodiversity (Anthony, 2016).
